description: Very well made markdown editor. Hard to believe I'm getting this for free.
The insert function make it very pleasant to use. Reccomend it a lot!

Given it's FOSS, it feels a bit wrong to complain. Overall I would say it works fairly well, but the editor will often get into a bad state that is hard to fix.

Things that flake almost always: automatic insertion of speckal markdown characters like '*' is often not what is intended, and the auto-deletion of these characters can be worse.

Things that flake often: bulleted/numbered lists, in particular sometimes it gets into weird states with orphan bullets. Also undo function is often unpredictable.

Things that flake occasionally: I've at least once gotten into a state where I basically had to close the editor and restart at my last save, because the editor state was so messed up.
summary: Nice for open source, but finicky editing

description:
I've tried a number of markdown editors, and I keep coming back to this one. I'm not sure it's my favorite, but it performs its purpose without too many quirks and doesn't soak up system resources.

I'm not convinced it's the best markdown text editor, but I don't regret installing and using it.
summary: The Markdown Editor I Keep Coming Back To

description: I love it, with every update is getting better and better. Totally recommended, you may prefer other editors but it is definetly worth a try.
It's awesome - just what developers need.
Instantly fell in love. Minimal. Beautiful. Fast. No bloat.
Very easy to use and beautifully designed user interface. I absolutely love this app!!
Nice with keyboard shortcuts and working on formatted text. Export to pdf also works.
Good looking but the core of the app, markdown writing, is hard to grasp, i still don't know how to insert a basic empty line, every time i write empty lines the app deletes them.
summary: Good looking but markdown writing is very restrictive
